```{r education germany 2000 - 2018}
library(tidyverse)

alldata <- read_csv("qog_eureg_wide1_nov20.csv")

limited <- filter(alldata, region_name == "GERMANY")

yearsData <- select(limited, region_name, year)

filtered <- select(limited, eu_edatt_ed02_y2564f_nuts0:eu_empl_edltotal_nuts0)

filtered <- select(filtered, ends_with("nuts0"))

merged <- bind_cols(yearsData, filtered)

merged <- filter(merged, year >= 2000 & year < 2019)

merged

# Diagram mit Männer und Frauen in Prozent, deren höchster Abschluss der Grundschulabschluss ist
ggplot(data = merged) +
    geom_line(mapping = aes(x = year, y = eu_edatt_ed02_y2564f_nuts0, color = "blue")) +
    geom_line(mapping = aes(x = year, y = eu_edatt_ed02_y2564m_nuts0, color = "red"))
```

# Notizen:
- tourismus - environment -> müll zu nummer von hotels (kein gutes diagram)
- health - education -> apotheker zu education 25 - 64
